How would sshfs help you there?
sshfs is for mapping an outbound ssh connection on your server to a mountpoint. It won't help any other clients that ssh into it to get access to files on the server.

If you're talking about browsing the contents of your server from a Windows client, you can use any program that supports scp or sftp. Filezilla and WinSCP are two popular free programs that can do that.
